summary: The document comprises payroll authorization forms for Clifford A. Fenton, Jr., detailing his role as Chief Investigator for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), including salary adjustments and position changes from 1976 to 1978. Additionally, it includes a notification from the Assassination Records Review Board about the postponement of certain records' release due to privacy concerns over Social Security numbers, illustrating the bureaucratic payroll processes within the U.S. House of Representatives.
key_findings: Clifford A. Fenton, Jr. was a Chief Investigator for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA).
Documented salary adjustments and position changes for Fenton from December 1976 to December 1978.
The Assassination Records Review Board delayed the release of some records to protect Social Security numbers, citing privacy concerns.
The document sheds light on the payroll authorization procedures in the U.S. House of Representatives.
